revised_title: Edmund Halley's Inquiry into the Change of Star Latitudes
tldr: Edmund Halley investigates the change in latitudes of some prominent stars and compares them to the observations made by ancient astronomers like Ptolemy and Hipparchus. He finds that the latitudes of three stars contradict the supposed greater obliquity of the ecliptic and suggests that these stars may have a particular motion of their own, which could be responsible for the observed changes.
